09:00 <lucaa> has quit  
09:04 <tillo> Hello everyone! I'm trying to find a way to list the recent activity on a 4.2 as well as its subwikis (also 4.2). Any pointers?  
09:07 <tillo> Oh wait, I just found out WikiCode.LastWikiModificationsCode, I guess it's what I'm looking for.  
09:17 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <tmortagne> tillo: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Activity+Report maybe  
09:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <tmortagne> seems old enough to work with 4.2  
09:29 <tmortagne> ha actually it seems to be part of http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Admin+Tools+Application  
09:30 <tillo> Thanks, it probably would have worked but WikiCode.LastWikiModificationsCode had everything I needed.  
09:30 <tillo> I just had to make sure no modifications were made on a old production server after migration :)  
09:30 <tmortagne> I don't think LastWikiModificationsCode is based on activity stream  
09:30 <tmortagne> so it's probably pretty slow  
09:30 <tmortagne> LastWikiModificationsCode is super old  
09:31 <tillo> Well, it listed pages on subwikis and their modification time, and I only had to use it once.  
09:32 <tmortagne> ok did not know it was for a test  
09:32 <tmortagne> in that case yes it should give you the right informations

17:09 <vmassol> tada!  
17:21 <tillo> Import problem on 6.0.1: http://www.zimagez.com/zimage/screenshot-05232014-051919pm.php shouldn't it differentiate correctly between dots as space separator and dots as part of the page name?  
17:23 <vmassol> tillo: it should, could you please report a jira issue? ATM several dots are not supported in the XAR import AFAIK  
17:27 <tillo> :(  
17:32 <tmortagne> it's possible the issue is in the export and not the import  
17:32 <tmortagne> if the export did not properly escape the dots that's the behavior you will get  
17:33 <vmassol> yes that's possible  
17:33 <tmortagne> in any case of you can provide a WAR with which you reproduce the issue it should be easy to see  
17:34 <tillo> It was created with a 4.2, IIRC.  
17:34 <tillo> Or older...  
17:34 <tillo> I'll let lynxt jump in, he's the one working on it :D  
17:34 <tmortagne> a old version of XWiki would not do that escaping  
17:34 <tmortagne> so that could be it  
17:34 <lynxt> the question is : is there a safe way to export wiki pages  
17:35 <tmortagne> (since escaping to support dot used to not exist at all)  
17:36 <vmassol> lynxt: why do you wish to export pages?  
17:36 <vmassol> if the reason is because of the upgrade then it shouldn't be necessary  
17:36 <vmassol> since you don't need to export/reimport when doing an upgrade  
17:37 <lynxt> yeah but the wizard crashes when doing the upgrade  
17:37 <tmortagne> lynxt: it's still possible it's the import so it would be great if you could provide a XAR in a jira issue and say you have an import issue  
17:37 <tillo> It's a 500MB XAR with internal secrets. :D sorry  
17:38 <tmortagne> an extract of it maybe  
17:38 <tmortagne> like one page from the zip  
17:38 <tillo> Yeah, that may be possible.  
17:38 <tmortagne> (the XAR is just a zip)  
17:39 <tmortagne> at worst even if the issue is on export the document reference is stored in several way, I can maybe find a hack to support packages like this  
17:41 <tillo> Ah! We found out that using the native Export it escapes correctly, Export Tools from Admin Tools not.  
17:41 <tillo> Unfortunately a complete export is too large to be imported.  
17:42 <tillo> Anyway lynxt is currently on it, we'll keep you updated.  
17:44 <vmassol> would be nice to report this for the admintools app  
17:44 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/ADMINTOOL  
17:45 <tmortagne> tillo: AFAIK http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Large+Wiki+Export do its job properly  
17:46 <tmortagne> and it support any size of wiki  
17:48 <tillo> tmortagne: he'll try with the latest version of Admin Tools and try that afterwards, thanks.  
17:55 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki
